absorb: To take in or soak up liquid or energy.
accent: A distinctive way of pronouncing words.
admire: To look at with respect or approval.
advice: Guidance offered to help someone decide.
agenda: A list of things to be discussed.
almond: Edible nut with a hard shell.
anchor: Heavy object used to keep a ship still.
appear: To become visible or seem to exist.
arctic: Relating to the North Pole region.
attach: Join or connect one thing to another.
author: Writer of a book or article.
baboon: Large African monkey with dog-like face.
bakery: Place where bread and pastries are made.
banana: Long curved fruit with soft flesh.
banish: To drive someone away or exile them.
beacon: Light that guides or warns ships.
behold: To see or observe something remarkable.
belong: Be the property of or be part of.
blazer: Formal jacket worn on special occasions.
branch: Part of tree growing from trunk.
breath: Air taken into lungs and released.
bundle: A group of things bound together.
butter: Yellow dairy product made from cream.
cactus: Plant with thick stems and spines.
campus: Grounds of a school or university.
cancel: To call off or end something.
cattle: Large farm animals such as cows.
cement: Powder mixed with water to form concrete.
clinic: Place where medical treatment is given.
comedy: Genre of entertainment that is humorous.
comply: Act according to rules or requests.
cotton: Soft white fiber grown on plants.
couple: Two people in a romantic relationship.
coyote: Wild dog-like animal from North America.
damage: Harm that reduces value or usefulness.
degree: Unit of measurement or academic award.
desert: Dry area with sand and little rain.
design: Plan or drawing for building something.
detail: Small part of a whole thing.
devote: Give time or effort to a particular task.
differ: Be unlike or distinct from something else.
dinner: Main meal eaten in the evening.
double: Twice as much or twice in number.
editor: Person who prepares content for publication.
empire: Group of countries ruled by one power.
estate: Large area of land with buildings.
expert: Person highly skilled in a field.
fairly: In a just or reasonable way.
female: Belonging to the sex that bears offspring.
finger: One of five digits on the hand.
flight: Act of flying through the air.
flower: Colorful and fragrant part of a plant.
freeze: Turn liquid into solid by cold.
friend: Person you have a bond with.
galaxy: Massive system of stars and planets.
garden: Area where plants and flowers grow.
ghetto: Poor urban area with limited resources.
google: Popular search engine and tech company.
handle: Part of something designed to hold.
health: State of physical or mental well-being.
heaven: Place believed to be home of God or saints.
height: Measurement of how tall something is.
hidden: Kept out of sight or secret.
hockey: Sport played on ice or field.
impact: Effect or influence of an action.
income: Money earned from work or business.
inform: Give facts or knowledge to someone.
injury: Physical harm or damage to a body.
insect: Small animal with six legs and often wings.
intend: Plan or mean to do something.
intake: Amount taken in, such as food or air.
invite: Ask someone to attend or join.
italic: Text style that slants to the right.
itself: Refers back to the subject previously mentioned.
jargon: Special words used by a group or profession.
juggle: Keep several objects moving in the air.
jumble: Mix things together in a messy way.
junior: Lower in rank or younger in age.
kaboom: Onomatopoeia for a loud explosion sound.
kidnap: Take someone away illegally and hold them.
kidney: Organ that filters waste from the blood.
kilner: Jarmaker or may refer to a type of jar.
kismet: Fate; destiny that is meant to be.
kneads: Press and work dough with hands.
ladder: Portable steps for reaching high places.
lactic: Relating to lactic acid or milk.
lamina: Thin plate or layer; thin sheet.
lancer: Mounted soldier armed with a lance.
latent: Present but not yet visible or active.
launch: Set something in motion, like a rocket.
leader: One who guides or directs others.
league: Group united for a common purpose.
legacy: Something handed down from the past.
length: Measurement from one end to another.
letter: Character used in writing or a written message.
liquid: Substance that flows freely like water.
listen: Pay attention to sound or speech.
lodger: Person who rents a room in someone’s house.
lonely: Feeling sad due to lack of companionship.
longer: Comparative of long; more in length.
lunacy: State of being crazy or insane.
magpie: Bird known for collecting shiny objects.
maiden: A young unmarried woman; first occurrence.
manual: Operated by hand rather than automatically.
marble: Hard, polished rock used for sculpture.
marine: Relating to the sea or ocean.
market: Place where goods are bought and sold.
matrix: Rectangular array; a structure or environment.
median: Middle value in a data set.
method: A way of doing something systematically.
minute: Very small; also a unit of time (6 letters).
misery: State of great unhappiness or suffering.
mobile: Able to move or be moved easily.
modern: Relating to the present or recent times.
modest: Humble about one’s abilities or achievements.
module: A self-contained unit within a system.
moment: A very short period of time.
muscle: Tissue that produces force and movement.
muster: Gather or assemble people or things.
nachos: Snack of tortilla chips with toppings (6 letters).
napkin: Cloth or paper for wiping mouth or hands.
nation: Large group of people under a government.
nature: All living things and environment together.
nectar: Sweet liquid in flowers consumed by pollinators.
nicely: In a pleasant or satisfactory way.
noodle: Long pasta or a silly person.
object: Thing that can be seen or touched.
octave: Series of eight notes in music.
orange: Citrus fruit with a bright color.
pamper: Spoil by giving too much comfort.
parish: Area served by a local church.
pepper: Spice that adds heat or flavor.
period: Length of time with a beginning and end.
pickle: Preserved food with salt or vinegar.
pillow: Soft cushion for resting the head.
plaque: Decorative tablet or coating on teeth.
plasma: State of matter like ionized gas.
plunge: Jump or dive quickly into something.
prayer: Words said to communicate with God.
priest: Religious leader authorized to perform rites.
python: Large snake; also a programming language.
quiver: Shake slightly from emotion or cold.
radius: Distance from center to circle edge.
record: Set highest achievement or preserved data.
regret: Feel sad about a past action.
remote: Far away in distance or connection.
